snippet.title: Game guide: Cowboys v Storm
snippet.content: NRL ROUND 22 NORTH QUEENSLAND COWBOYS V MELBOURNE STORM 1300SMILES Stadium, tonight, kick-off 7.50pm Referees: Ashley Klein and Alan Shortall Review officials: Bernard Sutton and Luke Patten UBET odds: Cowboys $2.65, Storm $1.50 COWBOYS 1 Lachlan Coote 2 Kyle Feldt 3 Justin O'Neill 4 Kane Linnett 5 Antonio Winterstein 6 Te Maire Martin 7 Michael Morgan 8 John Asiata 9 Jake Granville 10 Scott Bolton 11 Gavin Cooper (c) 12 Ethan Lowe 13 Jason Taumalolo 14 Ben Hampton 15 Coen Hess 16 Shaun Fensom 17 Corey Jensen 18 Braden Uele 20 Sam Hoare Coach: Paul Green STORM 1 Billy Slater 2 Suliasi Vunivalu 3 Will Chambers 4 Curtis Scott 5 Josh Addo-Carr 6 Ryley Jacks 7 Cooper Cronk 8 Jesse Bromwich 9 Cameron Smith (c) 10 Tim Glasby 11 Felise Kaufusi 12 Joe Stimson 13 Dale Finucane 14 Nelson Asofa-Solomona 15 Kenny Bromwich 16 Jordan McLean 17 Slade Griffin 18 Nate Myles 19 Jahrome Hughes 20 Brodie Croft 21 Robbie Rochow Coach: Craig Bellamy HEAD-TO-HEAD Played 34, Cowboys 10, Storm 24 AT TOWNSVILLE Played 18, Cowboys 6, Storm 12 PAST THREE MEETINGS Rd 15, 2017: Storm 23 bt Cowboys 22 at AAMI Park Qualifying final: Storm 16 bt Cowboys 10 at AAMI Park Rd 21, 2016: Storm 16 bt Cowboys 8 at 1300SMILES Stadium KEY MATCH-UPS FULLBACK: Lachlan Coote (Cowboys) v Billy Slater (Storm) They may be without Cameron Munster, but Melbourne will be boosted by the return of Billy Slater from a week out with concussion. It only adds another attacking weapon to a Melbourne team which completely dominated Manly 40-6 last week. Coote has stepped up his attacking role in recent weeks and set up two tries with quick hands against the Roosters last Saturday. He and Michael Morgan need to continue to take the attacking load, especially in the opposition 20-metre zone. HOOKER: Jake Granville (Cowboys) v Cameron Smith (Storm) Cameron Smith only enhanced his reputation as possibly the greatest ever after tearing Manly apart in his 350th NRL game last week. There's no bigger individual challenge for Granville than coming up against the Kangaroos skipper, but the speedy dummy half has been a major reason why the Cowboys have kept their season afloat without Johnathan Thurston. The Cowboys must win the wrestle in the middle third for Granville's running game to have any impact. PROP: Coen Hess (Cowboys) v Jordan McLean (Storm) Hess will eventually move back to his preferred second row spot but the importance of his impact off the bench was magnified when the Roosters manhandled the Cowboys once their starters left the field. He will need to at least match the impact of future Cowboys teammate Jordan McLean, who will head to Townsville next year. McLean was 18th man for Australia against New Zealand earlier this year and is regarded as a future NSW Blue. BY THE NUMBERS 18: The winning team has scored more than 18 points in just two of the past seven matches between these two clubs. Expect another defence-oriented contest. 38: The most tries scored for a player in their first two NRL seasons, a record now jointly held by Storm winger Suliasi Vunivalu after his four-pointer against Manly last week. 9: The number of Origin stars to feature in this match across both sides. The last time they met in round 15, none of the big names were available. THE BIG QUESTIONS Can the Cowboys prove they can compete with the best? They did that for 40 minutes against the second-placed Roosters last week but once the hosts upped the intensity in the second half, they couldn't go with them. Whether or not the second half fade out was a blip on the radar will be revealed tonight against the best team in the competition. The Cowboys will want to make this a low-scoring battle of attrition but will also have to throw plenty at the best organised defensive line in the NRL. How much will Melbourne miss Cameron Munster? He announced himself as a superstar with his brilliant debut performance for Queensland in Origin III, but will miss tonights' clash with an ankle injury. Smith, Slater and Cooper Cronk provide the class but five-eighth Munster is the x-factor which thrives off their work and can break a game open. Ryley Jacks is a capable replacement but the Storm are in good hands with Munster once the 'big three' retire.

sindex.name: NORTH QUEENSLAND COWBOYS V MELBOURNE STORM
